lexUnit.name: pleasing.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: causing feelings of satisfaction and happiness

sentence.text: Far from wanting to create aesthetically pleasing colour combinations , he sought to convey a message about ` the human drama " which ` transcended self " .
Taking these factors into account , there have recently been put forward several imaginative proposals aimed at encouraging farmers and landowners to create a more aesthetically pleasing landscape .
As well as being aesthetically pleasing , trees absorb carbon dioxide which is thought to be making holes in the ozone layer .
His face took on a more pleasing expression , the immense frown being jacked upwards into an insouciant grin .
You may find it more pleasing and effective to range together a selection of complementary shapes , rather than just a hotchpotch of squares , circles , ovals and rectangles .
The smell of wood dye and shavings , more pleasing to her than any perfume , filled the air as she worked contentedly on .
This is a beautiful elegant Georgian house with ivy-clad stone walls , fine proportions and a very pleasing aspect .
Although perhaps not in the strictest sense of the word ` beautiful " , the American girl had a very pleasing appearance , and despite her height and strong build , an attractive feminine figure .
Her profile was strong but nevertheless pleasing .
The room , which contained nothing superfluous , nothing pretentious , was both pleasing and extraordinarily comforting and , for a moment , he wondered why .
During the past ten to 15 years a few new bungalows have been built , and with the eight council houses built in the 1930s , there is a pleasing variety of architectural styles .
The colour scheme is delicate and pleasing and most of the rooms have a view of the Minster .
Everything about this book is pleasing , and everyone who has been involved with its creation deserves the greatest praise .
The results of the exercise were pleasing , and most wards introduced the scheme without any problems .
Her room , too , was a pleasing blend of cream and rose-pink , the colours of the curtains picked out in the material of the plump duvet and the matching bed linen .
The Renaissance is frequently presented as what is truest , best , and most pleasing about the early modern period .
The lighting is soft and pleasing due to the marble sheets in the windows ( 201 ) .
Computer equipment may be designed in such a way that it is aesthetically pleasing as well as functional , there may be something novel about the design which falls short of the scope of patents .
And if a woman is tackling strenuous , dirty , physical tasks , she does not want to bother about presenting a pleasing picture ; clothes suitable for the job are a priority above a glamorous image .
The interior is furnished in period style with a pleasing 19th-century watercolour collection completing the picture .

There are several other winter flowers , such as snowdrops and similar bulbs , that can also be pressed with pleasing results , so you might consider keeping a particular area of your garden solely for winter pressing .
As well as fonts you can use borders around a range and can shade a range and can therefore achieve pleasing results .
Even fairly inexpensive keyboards make pleasing sounds .
` I 'd rather not , " she said with feeling , and he laughed softly , a husky , strangely pleasing sound that sent little quivers of sensation rippling along her spine .
Mr Wilson said : ` The most pleasing thing is that we attract people to activities here who do n't necessarily have anything to do with the Baptist church . "
With this pleasing thought she settled more comfortably and looked about her .
It 's irritating to see her there , all nervy and squeaky , in her clothes for motoring out to the country in ; but oddly touching and pleasing that she should have come .
She and Lucy would have a drink after work on Fridays , sometimes an early supper , a few hours to unwind : a pattern pleasing to both .
Either they win the faint gratitude of listeners by reminding them of the original with a faithful remake , or they rip the original to shreds and reassemble it in a manner pleasing to themselves .
His mobile furniture is mostly rather ungainly , although his marquetry ornament is brilliant and ( again , when not figural ) pleasing in the extreme .
She was thin and small , her body like a nymphet 's and surprisingly pleasing in the fading light .
Such structures are indeed referred to in computer science jargon as trees , and the technical literature abounds with pleasing arboreal metaphors such as roots , branches and leaves .
Rosa had found , by diligent searching , a Japanese quartz watch which had a second hand , a pleasing appearance and several other useful qualities .
Cast as the gaoler 's daughter , she had a pleasing soprano voice and was an adequate actress by the undemanding standards of grand opera .
A terrace of visually pleasing stone cottages facing the neat village green are dated 1846 .
Probably the most pleasing aspect is the number of families now taking an active part in the rally scene , as this can only bode well for the future of metal detecting in this country .
Asia reported strong premium growth and produced an underwriting profit with the improved performance in Hong Kong being particularly pleasing .
The idea of the lofty Naylor Massingham sitting impatiently outside her apartment block for an hour was one which Leith found quite pleasing -- so much so that she almost broke into a smile .
The Editor found it pleasing to think of office workers relaxing in the saloon 's comfortable armchairs and listening to music for a while instead of the click of typewriters .
Equally pleasing to boss Dave Maloney was the confidence-boosting display , achieved in spite of questionable sendings-off that saw Skem end with nine men .
